mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus¶

Functions for processing stimulus data which includes stimuli presented to subjects and subject behavior

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.correct_stimulus_outliers(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, max_g=10, window_size=3, force_copy=False, iterations=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Remove outliers in data by detecting large changes and replacing with the mean value of neighboring points

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.smooth_stimulus(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, temporal_sigma=0.5, **kwargs)[source]¶

Smooth timestamped data with a gaussian filter.

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.stimulus_at_times(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, select_times, stack_times=False)[source]¶

Get the value of timestamped data at the given times using linear interpolation over each dimension

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.stimulus_at_times_binned_mean(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, temporal_bin_centers)[source]¶

Calculate the stimulus in temporal bins (defined by a list of bin centers) as the mean value of the stimulus in that bin

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.stimulus_at_times_binned_proba(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, temporal_bin_centers, stimulus_bin_centers, fill_value=nan, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calculate the stimulus in temporal bins as a probability defined by the marginalized occupancy of the stimulus in the time bin

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.stimulus_gradient(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, reduced=True)[source]¶

Calculate the gradient of timestamped data

mlneuro.preprocessing.stimulus.stimulus_gradient_mask(stimulus_times, stimulus_data, min_g=0, max_g=inf, as_stds=False, invert=False)[source]¶

Create a mask of stimulus data based on the velocity of the stimulus
